subject: thoughts to live by
reflection: This is love in the making. The love of God is not created--it is His nature. When we receive the life of Christ through the Holy Spirit, He unites us with God so that His love is demonstrated in us. The goal of the indwelling of the Holy Spirit is not just to unite us to God, but to do it is such a way that we will be one with the Father in exactly the same way Jesus was. So what kind of oneness did Jesus Christ have with the Father??? He had such a oneness with the Father that He was obedient when His Father who sent Him down here to be poured out for us. AND He says to us, "As the Father has sent Me, I also send you." (John 20:21) If we truly love the Lord, we have no business being guided by natural emotions, we have to feed His sheep. Beware of counterfeiting the love of God by following your own natural human emotions, sympathies, or understandings. That will only serve to revile and abuse the true love of God.
prayer: Pray that your oneness with the Father would be like that of Christ. Pray that you would be obedient to God's commission, not out of sympathy but out of Christ-like love. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: However, I consider my life worth nothing to me, if only I may finish the race and complete the task the Lord Jesus has given me, the task of testifying to the Gospel of God's grace. (Acts 20:24)
reflection: It is easier to serve or work for God without a vision and without a call, because then you are not bothered by what He requires. Common sense covered with a layer of Christian emotion, becomes our guide. You may be more prosperous and successful from the world's perspective, and will have more leisure time, if you never acknowledge the call of God. But once you receive a commission from Jesus Christ, the memory of what God asks of you will always be there to prod you on to do His will. You will no longer be able to work for Him on the basis of common sense. What do you count in your life as "dear to you?" If you have not been seized by Jesus Christ and have not surrendered yourself to Him, you will merely consider the time you decide to give God and your own ideas of service dear. Paul said he considered his life dear so that he might fulfill the ministry he had received, and he refuses to use his energy on anything else. Paul was absolutely indifferent to any consideration other than that of fulfilling the ministry he had received. Never consider whether or not you are of use, but always consider that "YOU ARE NOT YOUR OWN" (I Corinthians 6:19). You are His.
prayer: Pray that your wants and wishes are in accord with His will. Pray that He would strengthen you for His service. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: However, I consider my life worth nothing, if only I may finish the race and complete the task the Lord Jesus has given me, the task of testifying to the Gospel of God's grace. (Acts 20:24).
reflection: Our joy should come from seeing the complete fulfillment of the specific purpose for which we were created and born again, not from successfully doing something of our own choosing. The Joy our Lord experienced came from doing what the Father had sent Him to do. AND He says to us, "As the Father sent me, I also send you" (John 20:21). Have you received a ministry from the Lord? If so, you must be faithful to it, to consider your life valuable only for the purpose of fulfilling that ministry. Knowing that you have done what Jesus sent you to do, think how satisfying it will be to hear Him say to you "Well done, good and faithful servant" (Matthew 25:21). We each have to find a niche in life, and spiritually we find it when we receive a ministry from the Lord. But to do this we must have close fellowship with Jesus and must know Him as more than our personal Savior. In John 21:17 Jesus asks "Do you love Me?" Then "Feed My sheep." If we look closely we should realize that He is not offering us a choice of how we can serve Him; He is asking for absolute loyalty to His commission, a faithfulness to what we discern when we are in the closest fellowship with God.
prayer: Pray that you would be sensitive and faithful to do what God has called you to do. Pray for a closer fellowship with Him. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: We put no stumbling block in anyone's path so that our ministry (or life) will not be discredited. Rather, as servants of God we commend ourselves in every way: in great endurance; in troubles, hardships and distresses; (2 Corinthians 6:3, 4)
reflection: When you have no vision from God, no enthusiasm left in your life, and no one watching and encouraging you, it requires the grace of Almighty God to take the next step in your devotion to Him. This is what is needed in the reading and study of His Word, in your family life, and in your duty to Him. It takes much more of the grace of God, and a much greater awareness of drawing upon Him, to take that next step, than it does to preach the Gospel. Every Christian must experience the essence of the incarnation by bringing the next step down into flesh-and-blood reality and by working it out with His hands. We need to be careful so as to not lose interest and give up when we have no vision, no encouragement, and no improvement, but only experience our every day trivial tasks. The thing that really testifies for God and for the people of God in the long run is steady perseverance, even when the work can not be seen by others. The only way to live an undefeated life is to live looking to God. Never allow yourself to think that some tasks are beneath your dignity or to insignificant for you to do, remind yourself of the example of Christ in (John 13:1-17)
prayer: Ask God to keep the eyes of your spirit open to the risen Christ, and His example. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Who will bring any charge against those whom God has chosen? it is God who justifies. Who is he who condemns? Christ Jesus, who died, more than that, who was raised to life, is at the right hand of God and is also interceding for us. Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall trouble or hardship or persecution or famine or nakedness or danger or sword??? As it is written: "for your sake we face death all day long we are considered as sheep to be slaughtered." No, in all these things we are more than conquers through Him who loved us. (Romans 8:33-37)
reflection: Paul is speaking of all the things that seem likely to separate a saint from the love of God. But the remarkable thing is that nothing can come between the love of God and a saint. The things that Paul mentions in these verses can and do disrupt the close fellowship of our soul with God and separate our natural life with Him. But none of them is able to come between the love of God and the soul of a Christian on the spiritual level. The underlining foundation of the Christian faith is the undeserved, limitless miracle of the love of God that was exhibited on the Cross of Calvary, a love that is not earned and can never be. This is the reason Paul says, "in all these things we are more than conquerors."
prayer: Thank You Lord for the Victory we have in Jesus! Amen.

reflection: This particular Psalm is devoted to the praise of God's mercy: In each of the twenty-six verses we have the expression: "His mercy endureth forever." The everlasting, unchangeable mercy of God is cause for unceasing praise and thanksgiving. Please take time to read about God's mercy in the well-known Psalm 103. Oh, how often we read these familiar words without the least thought of their immeasurable greatness! Be still and meditate until the heart responds to the words of this wonderful Psalm.
prayer: Take time to thank God for His wonderful mercy and loving kindness. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: God the Father chose you long ago, and the Spirit has made you holy. As a result, you have obeyed Jesus Christ and are cleansed by His blood. (I Peter 1:2)
reflection: As we see here in this verse all three members of the Trinity are mentioned: God the Father, God the Son (Jesus Christ), and God the Holy Spirit. Another important fact to recognize is that all three member of the Trinity work to bring about our Salvation. The Father chose us before we chose Him (Eph. 1:4). Jesus Christ, the Son died for us while we were still sinners (Romans 5:6-10). The Holy Spirit brings us the benefits of salvation and sets us apart (makes us holy, sanctifies us) for God's service (2 Thessalonians 2:13) Let us always remind ourselves that, for all our communion with God, the presence and the power of the Son and the Spirit are absolutely necessary.
prayer: Give thanks for all that He has done for us (me) even before we (I) Surrendered to Him. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "God is love; and he that dwelleth in love dwelleth in God, and God in him" (1 John 4:16).
reflection: The best and most wonderful word in heaven is Love. for God is Love. And the best and most wonderful word in the inner chamber must be-- Love. For God meets us there in Love. What is love? It is the deep desire to give oneself for the beloved. Love finds its joy in imparting all that it has to make the loved one happy. And the heavenly Father, who offers to meet us in the inner chamber-let there be no doubt of this in our minds--has no other object than to fill our hearts with His love. All the other attributes of God that are mentioned in His Word find in this their highest glory. The true and full blessing of the inner chamber is nothing less than a life in the abundant love of God.
prayer: As you set yourself to pray, pray for a greater faith in His everlasting love. Pray that the precious truth of (I John 2:1) would be a reality in your heart."Behold what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us." Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "On Thee do I wait all the Day" (Psalms 22:5).
reflection: "Waiting upon God" in this expression we find one of the deepest truths of God's Word in regard to the attitude of the soul in its communion with God. Waiting upon God. Just think --- maybe if we would just give Him an extra minute He would reveal Himself to us; that He may teach us all His will; that He may do to us what He has promised; that in all things He may be the infinite God. Waiting upon God. Is an attitude of the soul --- with which each day should begin. Upon awakening each morning, in quiet meditation, in the expression in prayer share your deepest longings and desires. In the course of our daily work, in our striving after obedience and holiness, in all our struggles against sin and self-will in everything there should be a waiting upon God to receive what He will bestow, to see what He will do, to allow Him to be Almighty God. Wait on God meditating on these things, and they will help you to value the precious promises of God's Word. They that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength. Wait on the Lord, be of good courage, and He shall strengthen thine heart. The deep root of all Scriptural theology is this: Absolute dependence on God. As we exercise this spirit, it will become more and more natural and blessedly possible to say: "On Thee do I wait all the day."
prayer: Pray that each day you would take the time to wait upon the Lord and be sensitive to His will. Amen.

As we exercise this spirit, it will become more and more natural and blessedly
possible to say: "On Thee do I wait all the day."

Prayer Suggestion:
Pray that each day you would take the time to
wait upon the Lord and be sensitive to His will...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
